title: Mauricio Pochettino has turned Spurs into serious title contenders for the first time in the Premier League era
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has turned Spurs into serious title contenders for the first time in the Premier League era The Argentinian celebrated his 100th game in charge of Spurs with a 1-0 win over Middlesbrough Share Kane's goal was enough to see off a defensive Boro side (Photo: Justin Setterfield) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Whether they catch Chelsea or not is immaterial. 
During his first 100 games in charge of Spurs, Mauricio Pochettino has achieved something no other boss has managed during the Premier League era. 
He has convinced us to see his club as serious title contenders. 
Harry Kane’s penalty made this the second successive season in which Tottenham have emerged as the biggest dangers to the league leaders. 
Yes, the Gunners finished second last season, but by then the title had gone to Leicester and Spurs had Champions League football wrapped up. The Spurs boss has been in charge for 100 games (Photo: Ian Walton / Getty) 
This season Spurs have the best defence in the Premier League – last term it was joint-best – despite injuries to key men Toby Alderweireld, Jan Vertonghen and Danny Rose. 
Significantly, they also have heart. While Arsenal were bullied out of yet another title race by Chelsea on Saturday, Spurs are the only team to have beaten the Blues in the league since last September. 
When the going gets tough they can hang in there, stay patient and maintain their consistency. 
So while a growing number of fans at the other end of the Seven Sisters Road cannot wait to see Arsene Wenger go, Spurs would love another 100 games under Pochettino. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
